text: A Starling by Isaac Spackman, undated watercolor and gouache on vellum, Yale Center for British Art Isaac Spackman (died 7 January 1771) was an English painter. He practised about the middle of the eighteenth century, and is best known as a painter of birds and animals. Spackman died in Islington. ==References== * Category:1771 deaths Category:18th-century English painters Category:English male painters
title: Isaac Spackman
